# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

None.

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = Vector{String}()
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(str)
        word_length = length(word)
        if current_line * " " * word <= text_width
            current_line *= " " * word
        else
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
    end
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
str = "Hello World This is a very long sentence that should be wrapped at text_width=10 characters per line."
print(wrap_string(str))
```

This function splits the input string into words and builds an array of lines, ensuring that each line does not exceed the specified `text_width`. It also handles the case where the last line may not be full. Finally, it joins the lines back into a string with newline characters in between.
